name: Jordana Sager
text:
Amazing technical support. BEYOND terrible billing/customer service support. There is a complete lack of communication between these departments.
I have never in my life experienced such bad customer service. EVER. They made a mistake and forgot to backup my site due to a miscommunication between billing and technical support. I lost data ( no fault of theirs) and now have to pay a programmer to retrieve what he can from his old backup because of their error in not backing up the site- which i had paid for them to do. They refuse to talk over the phone to resolve the issue with us. And offered only to refund the amount we already paid in backup fees (which is a moot point since there is was no backup made)- Rather than offering a more reasonable solution. Its a fight over $55. Which clearly is worth more to them then a customer that pays $195 a month in hosting fees to them.
Really shocked. And so disappointed.
Be weary...

name: NevSkins Australia
text:
When will Simple Helix fix their automatic subscription issues???  Despite having an automatic subscription in place through Paypal since April, Simple Helix systems glitched and suspended my business website for late payment.   Incredibly lucky that one of our team was working in the back end of the site tonight and noticed the website was down with a big ACCOUNT SUSPENDED sign -- so we were able to fix it quickly with a manual payment.

When a business sets an account to automatic payment it is so that they don't have to keep checking payments have been taken out successfully each month -- why is this so difficult with Simple Helix ?

What is incredibly worrying, for my business, is just how many customers viewed the landing page with its single ACCOUNT SUSPENDED sign on it during the 1-2 hour window before we caught the issue and how many of those customers assumed we were out of business / or lost faith in our business ?     All because a Simple Helix system did not work as it should ?

Customer support were unhelpful and unapologetic.

name: Jared Melkun
text:
I've been using Simplehelix for a couple of years over several sites. My most recent site, on a shared hosting plan, regularly goes down due to PHP scripts run by other users on the server. This has happened three times that I know of (Simplehelix does not inform you of any outages) and each time the response has been that they are going to look into the issues. Today was the last straw -- I'm pulling all of my hosting from the company. I spend heavily on Google's AdWords to drive users to my sites; I lose money every time the site goes down. Further, Simplehelix does not consider time in which the server is not responding as downtime -- rather the server being actively connected to the internet seems to mean its up. As a result, Simplehelix claims their 99.9% reliability is met; it isn't - I was down for 35 minutes today alone.

I'm willing to overlook occasional issues, but the quality of service that I receive from this hosting company  has fallen off a cliff over the past calendar year. I'll never be back - don't make the same mistake I did.

text:
its a breeze to migrate to simplehelix, but thats where it stops...

i think they totally went off the charts with how bad support can get! words like terrible and horrible would be an understatement.. let me take you through my experience. they charge you an interest when your paypal subscription fails to deduct (note: i have a fully functioning paypal balance + credit card to back it up). no one likes to be charged interest when you're such a loyal customer who pays on time right? i pre-paid to avoid the interest because you know, they're so lenient and reasonable they would charge you interest ON TIME. oh.. wait, if this happens to you... they don't refund for pre-paid amounts. i should have expected it right? if you're thinking of hosting here... my advice is NO.. get something like shopify if you're going to start your business. uptime is great there too and u dont have to maintain your annoying monthly upgrades and people there are so nice!

simplehelix definitely has the most unhelpful crew ever.

text: I had an issue with my site that required a backup. I was having issues with my backup plugin so I had to request a restore on their end. Well, the person who handles billing is out on vacation and I can't login to the payment area to pay the invoice. Well, they won't restore the backup to fix our broken site that now doesn't work until we pay this $25 invoice. Crazy. You mean a $25 invoice that will get paid the next day is going to keep you from fixing my broken site today? I felt abandoned and helpless. Not a feeling you want when you need support. name: Matthew Perosi
text:
I have to detail a security breach situation caused by Simple Helix tech support.
My name and email was supposed to be removed from a client account on October 31, 2014.  Today is June 16, 2015 and my email address was CC'd in an unexpected trouble ticket thread initiated by my former client who could not log into their account.
Realizing this was not something I should be privy to I immediately replied to the thread and requested my email be removed from it.
I received an email acknowledgement within 14 minutes saying "Per Matt Perosi's request, we have removed him from the account." Yet, 8 hours later my email address is sill involved with this trouble ticket thread and their support person just sent me the complete login credentials.
I realize this is a very unusual situation, but there are many website consultants that work temporarily for different companies all the time.  Shouldn't Simple Helix have a perfected system to remove us consultants from customer accounts once our contracts expire?
They've just handed me the keys to an account I should not have access to and created a situation whereby I could be accused of harming a website I am no longer affiliated with.
Simple Helix is a good company, but I'm giving them 1 star here to call a lot of attention to this situation and to alert their customers to make sure you properly have SEO consultants removed from your accounts once consulting contract have expired.

I asked why PUT requests were being blocked by SimpleHelix and was told "we block them for security purposes" but they work perfectly on my other SimpleHelix account?

Once again, even after proving PUT requests are working on the other account, I get the same response - We block them for security purposes..

I will be moving away from SimpleHelix as soon as I find a more suitable host!

The cost to repair my work laptop was very reasonable, and as said I brought it back twice and they didn't charge anything. Very knowledgeable guys, very polite and curtious and very professional. text:

Didn't even make an attempt to check only said he wasn't sure then auggsugge I go elsewhere I got the feeling I was bothering him just by being a customer would not recommend and will never be back

resp.text: Thanks for your review. I just reviewed the recording to be sure you were helped as best as possible. We are a repair shop, and as such are unable to carry every different brand and model adapter. Dylan knew right off the bat that we do not carry the new Lenovo adapter you were searching for. We have in shop adapters that we use for repairs, he should have been more clear about his response. He also recommended Walmart, because he was trying to help you find the adapter. He gave you a card and asked you to keep us in mind in case you had anything we could help you with. Sorry you felt like he was dismissive, but we simply did not have what you were looking for. Best of luck on your search.

name: David Hill
text: Strictly about getting as much of your money for as little as possible.Deceptive and highly overpriced.Be sure you already know what's wrong before you bring your Pc there,if not they'll make it worse before making it better and charge 3 Times as much as original problem should have been.

resp.text:
Hi Stranger! Are you sure you left a review for the correct business? I have no record of you in my system, and I can assure you I would be aware of any such interaction as the one you described. I would love to hear from you, we do our best to correct any situation. 2519294609

Also, if you're able to provide me with the time that you interacted with my techs, I'll be sure to review any phone calls or video of the shop to make sure our high standards are being met. I'm having trouble understanding your review for a few reasons -

1- I have no documented interactions with you and am unable to reach you.
2- We NEVER charge for anything without the customers approval.
3- We always take into account the value of the equipment brought to us so we can justify the cost of repair. Unfortunately, a lot of equipment brought in for repair is not worth the cost of repair. We decline to repair a lot of equipment. In these situations we offer alternative solutions such as migrating to a new computer, or providing a backup so you can purchase equipment elsewhere.
4- There is another business in the area with a very similar name that has caused confusion in the past. I cannot speak to the quality of the work they perform, I just know we have been mistaken for them quite often.

Still looking forward to speaking with you personally and clearing up any confusion.
Judge Keeler - 251.929.4609

name: Gulf Bay Photography
text: I dropped off a pc due to freezing on monday night. They had it all week and picked it up on friday night. They stated it was the second hard drive causing the issues and all was perfect. I got home tonight plugged it in and froze up within 1 minute. How do you have a pc a whole week and the first minute I get it plugged back in the pc freezes again? Something is wrong and the problem was not diagnosed properly.

name: Mary T
text:
DO NOT USE THIS PLACE!!!

Took in my Galaxy S7 Edge after I dropped it and screen turned green and flickered. Everything else was working great, including charging.

Was told it needed new screen. Paid $230 with my debit card and was then informed that there would be no warranty. Got an email receipt.

Got my phone back a few days later and it was down to 1%. So I immediately tried to charge it and got an error message that the battery temp was too low to charge.

Went in the next morning and was told it needed a new battery because old battery would not charge new LED screen (which I should have been told on first visit). Paid $60 MORE. Also told there was no tax since I paid with cash and was not offered a receipt nor one by email (like previous time).

My husband picks the phone up, tries to charge it and gets the SAME error message.

He calls them and is now told that the motherboard is probably bad and it needs a new one. NO FLIPPING WAY was I giving them another dime!!

I am out almost $300 and STILL have no phone to use!!!

They basically  just took my money and did not fix my phone.

I DO NOT recommend this place AT ALL and will be contacting BBB!

resp.text: Mam, I'm sorry that the repair did not work out to your satisfaction. We did everything in our power to help you with your phone. And provided you with every option at our disposal. And we did everything that we could over the phone to explain to you the error that your phone was still having from both me and my assistant. Unfortunately sometimes when performing a repair, be it on a car a house or an electronic device there is more wrong with it than just the issue that you drop it off for. These issues are unfortunate, nonetheless, but sometimes they are there. I apologize you're unsatisfied, and if you change your mind and decide to get the device fixed as we said on the phone, the amount that you have already paid for the battery repair will apply towards the motherboard. I hope you have a great day and if you need anything else give us a call!!

Although my phone was repaired, I will not recomend them. I do not trust businesses that ask for payment up front and then tell you they have a no refund policy if their service comes into question. Just because you call something a store policy, does not make it legally or morally correct.
I award this business a negative one star rating.

resp.text: Glad that your phone works! I cannot find a ticket for repair with your info on it ... Nonetheless, the business policies that we've developed over the years are a direct reflection on experiences we've had in the past. And I assure you in this industry they are very commonplace. The parts that we use do carry a warranty. Again glad to hear that your phone's doing well, you need anything please let us know!

Hi Brandon!!!

I do remember the conversation with you and did agree that it would be no issue to refund you the overnight shipping. We received the part and had it in your hands today as well as the refund. and after watching the tape I couldn't find a single instance where my employee called you ridiculous. name: Harper Lee
text:
Total scam. First you pay 40 dollars to get the phone evaluated which was not explained from the start, then another hundred for a potential repair not a guaranteed repair mind you! I should have just got a replacement from my phone company for a hundred. I was trying to get my contacts. What a waste of forty dollars time  and potentially wasting a total of
140 dollars with no guarantee! He must pay for reviews as he is not credible or honest! Unbelievable, he is still in business! Don’t trust anything he says or states! Go elsewhere,  anywhere but there! Trust me there are far more reputable honest folks that charge the right amount to start and either can or can not do the repair.

I am reporting him to better business bureau for his deception and dishonesty.

resp.text:
Miss Lee we wish you the best as we did on the phone the other day. We charge 40 $ to diagnose any device that comes in unresponsive, to cover our costs  and then apply that money towards the total cost of the repair if the customer chooses to do so. We explain that without fail every time we do a diagnostic. I apologize for any misunderstanding that you had with us in our initial conversation.

We take the word guarantee very seriously, and would never guarantee repair on a phone we haven't seen in months. That Miss Lee and that alone is why would not guarantee a repair. We do guarantee our repairs and most of all parts have a lifetime warranty. I'm sorry that you felt that this review was necessary as well as  the conversation and language you used with us on the phone the other day was necessary but we do sincerely wish you the best.

JF

text: On 7/26/2018 approximately 1:15 pm I brought my laptop computer in to see if I could get it repaired. Due to a lack of parking area I almost had an accident with an older driver. Once I entered the store, I ask him did he see what was about to happen. He indicated that he did. Then he stated that people have accidents all the time.  I decided to take my business somewhere else because his lack of concern for a welfare of a potential customer. Besides he indicated that he did not need the business when I ask him.  I can not speak about how well they repair computers, I will leave that to the others who have comments.  I just wanted to share my personal experience.

name: Sidney Alene Coker
text:
I’m a middle school teacher and writer who tries heavily on my computer for work. My charging port was damaged and was melting charger tips, and only worked if I positioned the charging cord just so, usually with the tip supported by a pen or book on my desk. I had it repaired before at a since closed establishment that did what can only be described as a hack job. Because of these things I was extremely picky about where to take my business, and was checking the reviews for all local computer repair shops when I found this business.

Not only did they fix my computer in less than 24 hours, they listened to my concerns and explained what they would do to prevent the charging port coming loose again. The customer service was fantastic, the repair was perfect, and I cannot recommend this business enough. Their prices are extremely fair, especially considering the quality of service and repair, and the turnaround time made the price even more worth it.

Thank you so much!

resp.text: Thank you!!

text: Just an excellent overall experience. Great customer service, reasonable prices, and greased-lightning turnaround time. Seriously, the turnaround was so fast I was suspicious; but no, they're just that good!

Extremely professional and knowledgeable about computer hardware. Diagnosed my issue with my new CPU and motherboard, recommended what I should get, and will put it together for me once my parts come in (for the listed price, of course, which is extremely fair for the work put in). I could not recommend this business more.

Edit: Lowered to three stars. Open and closing times extremely misleading. Advertised to close at 6pm, but I've arrived about five times now between 5:00-5:20pm with no one who can help me being there. However, my original review still stands.

text: I would recommend Tyler to anyone.  He knows what he is doing.  He is knowledgeable and experienced.  He is professional.  His rates are reasonable.  He worked on 3 of our desk top computers he did good work and we are very pleased!

name: Ron Culbreth
text: I called Tyler and his team from Florida service my 87-year-old mother's desktop in Montgomery.  Tyler suggested that because the tower is heavy (plus I like to limit her driving as much as possible) that they come pick it up, make the necessary repairs and he said they could have it back that same day. Plus I know my Mom would not know how to make all the connections - AND I wanted them to see why her wireless printer wasn't working. That was a Friday morning when I called.  They picked it up at noon and returned 3ish and fixed her printer.  She had 137 incidents of malware !  She had let a phone scammer access her computer and he had her bank account info.  We caught it in time.  Tyler installed some security software.  All for I thought was a ridiculously low price.  Thank you so much.  Restored my peace of mind and my faith in good working folks of Montgomery.

name: Larry Summons
text: Went to have my computer checked out and the tech immediately knew what was wrong. name: Joseph Bamburg
text:
Turn around was extremely quick, service was very reasonably priced (especially compared to big box stores, I think Best Buy was going to charge me double what they did) and everyone I worked with in there was fun to talk with while waiting for the service to finish.

Also of note, much better timing when you're on a time crunch (absolute necessity to have the computer for bar prep). If I had relied on Geek Squad warranty, I'd be without a computer for three days. Took my computer in, diagnosed the problems in thirty minutes, ordered a part, installed said part, and did some updates in an hour and a half at most. While I was in there waiting during the servicing, had some great conversations. 10/10 hope I won't need them again but if I do will use them in a heartbeat.

name: Sam Sepulveda
text:
Probably the worse customer service I have ever received.  I took in a tablet with a cracked screen.  They told me it should only be 4 days as long as the parts came in quickly. They ordered the wrong part not once, not twice, not even three times, it took them four (4) times to get the right part in.  I had to call and came into their shop almost every week to find out a status.  Every time I went in, I was told someone else was working on my tablet, but the tech would call me that night to update what was going on.  I never received one phone call from any tech.
Something that was suppose to take 4 days took over 30 days!  When I took the unit home, the pen was missing, which they still have not replace.  Immediately the tables starting ghosting. I had to bring it back and they said it was loose wires.  Even now, the tablet is not working properly, but I would rather deal with the tablet than these guys.
I talked to the owner and told him exactly what happened and he only said he was sorry and their techs needed to work on their customer service!
I will never take anything back to these guys!  I cannot and will not recommend these guys to anyone!

resp.text: I'm incredibly disappointed to read this, Sam -- I can only imagine how frustrating this must have been. Rest assured. I'll look into this immediately to see what happened and how we can prevent this in the future. It's thanks to honest feedback like yours that we can continue to grow and improve our service, so I appreciate​ you reaching out about your experience. I hope we'll get the chance to show you just how we're putting your input into practice someday. -Elizabeth, General Manager

name: Aubrey Rogers
text: I asked to have the charge port on my tablet replaced. They told me the part would arrive within a few days and the work would take a few hours. Three weeks later they still didn't have the part in. I called them 3 times in three weeks to see if my tablet was ready, each time they said they still had not received the part and they would call me in a couple days. They never called me. Yesterday once again I called to see if it was ready, again they said no. I told the general manager I was tired of waiting, cancel my order, I'm coming to get my tablet. I got busy and wasn't able to pick it up till today. When I got there and asked for my device the general manager said they finally got the part in after I had called yesterday, and they installed it. How convenient that the part finally came in mere hours after I said I'm tired of waiting, cancel my order. I paid for the cost of the part and left with a tablet that still won't take a charge. I've been so busy and tired, it didn't occur to me till tonight that I told them to cancel my order and they still installed the part anyway, which didn't even fix the problem, AND I paid for it.

Each time the service goes down it's always the fault of "AT&T" or "the equipment is faulty" or some other excuse.  To make matters worse EVERY time it goes down it's down for hours!!

Not once has there been any solutions offered until I started sending letters requesting to discontinue my service without penalty.  And here we are again...service down and the technician has no answers for me.

Do your business a favor....go anywhere else but this company for reliable phone and internet service...

resp.text:
Dana,

I'm so sorry to hear you are having a bad experience with Slappey.  This is certainly not the type of reference we've built in our 34 years of business and would like for you to have the same great experience all of our customers enjoy.  We understand that a redundant solution was offered to your company by our service team at no charge to you (so you aren't affected when AT&T has issues).  Perhaps you were not personally aware of this offer, but we would strongly encourage you to allow Slappey to implement this solution to make sure we eliminate the impact of any AT&T outages.

If you do need further assistance, our President is always willing to get involved and come meet you to discuss how we can make sure you have the great service that our company is founded on.

Thanks,
Slappey Team

text:
What can I say, well to start with, I was not ready for the change to a New Company because I have been with Xerox for over 25 + Years. I have always been treated very well from them so, NO I did not want to change. After a while of thinking about it SEVERAL MONTHS and my Son hammering me with the RJ YOUNG name, I did it. I purchased a machine from RJ YOUNG.
At first I was skeptical and to be honest I really didn't want to give it a chance (The Machine), but I did and after several months and barely using the machine I starting coming more around it and using it a little more & more. Then I began to really like it because it really printed so nice and pretty fast. It only took me  8 to 10 months to like it but you have to understand I WAS A XEROX Man and I thought there was NOTHING out there but Xerox. The Xerox machine has ALWAYS  performed outstanding and the SERVICE was the best, I was spoiled from that. However, I found out that there was more out there than XEROX! I found out that RJ YOUNG was REAL and believe me they have made a believer out of me. The Service that I thought would not compare to XEROX, has showed me they are just as good and if not BETTER. I never thought I would say that but it is so true. I can not believe how fast the Service Technicians reply to the service calls. They are always polite, and get me back up and running in a very quickly manner. They have such good personalities and a smile! As for the Ladies at the Home Office, Oh My How can you NOT like them. They are AMAZING. They always tell me they will have my supplies on the way or a Technician asap. IT IS JUST SO HARD TO PUT IN WORDS what RJ Young has done for my business. This is a very caring company and to be honest I am so glad that I have some of their product and that I was introduced to the World outside of XEROX. RICO machines have made my life SO MUCH Better and I am so happy that I have changed. If you are not a part of RJ YOUNG, you are probably missing out on good PEOPLE and Great Machines.
David Santos,
Santos Printing Co.

name: SaintMegery15
text: So, walked in and was promptly greeted. Explained that I needed my screen replaced on my iPhone. I take it out to show the guy and he presses all over it, and while he is telling me my battery is swollen and causing the screen to bend, he turns it on and my screen was split in half! I couldn't use half my screen! I work 2 blocks away and have been very careful with my phone (have had a bent-ish screen for months!) so I really don't think this happened in my pocket. I called him out on it as soon as I saw the screen and he said "Look, you can't even use the screen now". He proceeded to talk about other things with my phone and didn't address the problem of him breaking my screen. He priced a screen and battery for me, but I declined and walked out because he broke my screen and absolutely refused to acknowledge it. I went back to the office, called this place and asked to speak to the manager. He asked what was wrong and I told him about the staff breaking my screen. He reveals that the guy I'm speaking with on the phone is the one who "helped" me in the store, and said that he is the manager and owned the store. I calmly explained to him what he did and how I watched him do it right in front of my face. He REFUSED to take responsibility and tried offering a $10 discount for both screen and battery instead. I said no thanks, and to have a nice day before hanging up. I am SO upset - I ended up just buying a new phone since it was about the same cost of what he would charge for a screen and battery. Find someone honest and who knows what they are doing to fix your cell phone - not here!

resp.text: Megan we’re sorry you had a bad experience with us and we do remember your issue. You came in with a swollen battery and an already cracked screen. The phone was off when you came in and we turned it on to a discolored lcd. You came in with a cracked screen and swollen battery and left with a cracked screen and swollen battery even after giving you a special repair price due to the repair being more than one issue and you mentioned working near by as we do like to be extra friendly with our neighbors and business close to our locations. The price you were given is a price no other repair store would give and if they did we would match but in all we’re sorry for any inconvenience you may have had coming to our store and would like to mention that the special price quote still stands if you wish to stop by. Thank you and have a great day!

I came in a few months ago with a cracked screen and the screen was replaced. A couple of weeks later my phone was dropped the phone landed on the corner with the case taking direct impact. I also had a screen protector. The screen cracked in the corner.

I have had my phone for a couple of years and the only time the screen cracked previously was when it landed face first without the screen protector. This leads me to believe the quality of the aftermarket screen was not very good.

resp.text:
Hello  Shir, we’re sorry you had a bad experience with us. Aftermarket screens have the same durability as the oem quality the difference is in the picture quality of the lcd only but the glass is the same, also it’s hard to compare the drop it took recently to previous drop lots of factors come into play. You also mentioned it was dropped on the corner of screen which is a very critical place of impact it’s the easiest place to crack on an iPhone specially if it’s the plus size phone but if you stop by we will try our best to make sure you get a better experience with us with a discounted price and free screen protector.

Thank you
Phone Clinic management

name: Harland Underhill
text:
Yesterday a friend sent me a link with a dire caveat that I'm probably not going to like this but I should see it. I open the link and lo and behold there is my wife, in all her glory, but with nothing else on. Now I've seen this picture before, she took it herself with my own personal phone. No where has this picture ever been shared, sent, or even seen by another soul other than myself. That is until I took my phone to get the battery taken care of at CH PC Repair.

Now I understand that this is partly my fault for leaving that picture on my phone, I accept that. I had honestly forgotten that it was on there. But I had incorrectly assumed that my personal data would remain personal while my phone was in Chad's possession, but apparently that isn't the case.

While the battery was fixed, I've now got to live with the fact that there are not so tasteful pictures of my wife out there for the world to see thanks to some perv PC repairman. If you for some reason desire to use this child for any repair work, make sure your data is extra secure or you wipe your memory card/hard drive before you take it to him. I'm over being mad at this, I'm just disgusted that there are people still like this out there in the world.

resp.text: Hello, Harland Underhill. I am having trouble reaching you.. I do not understand why you left such a review about me, and my business. I work extremely hard, and I take pride in my business. I would not do something of this matter. What would I benefit from this? nothing, nothing good at all. I am a man of integrity. I am known for the good work I do, and honestness.

name: Jason Williams
text:
This guy is awful.  No patience, no respect, no apologies when he screws up.  Everything is on his demands, but never his fault.  Respect is free, try giving it away sometime.

Don't believe his stories.  He complained in LESS than a week - regarding a shipment originating in Canada - which were the terms he agreed to when he purchased (and also mirrored by the eBay shipping expected time).  But mistakes happen - all I needed was for him to say 'Sorry, my mistake'...  But he couldn't do that - preferring to say that he would be leaving negative feedback (for something he was completely wrong about).  Fortunately I had not shipped the part yet, as I was going to be in the US shortly, and able to do a much quicker & more secure USPS shipment...  But once you threaten negative feedback over something that you're wrong about, and are repeatedly unable to understand that you're in the wrong - damn right I'm canceling that order.  I have the right to "fire" a customer who is not conducting themselves appropriately.

Most notable is the fact that negative feedback was left for me, and it took ~5 minutes for the eBay rep to review the details and get it taken down.  His complaints to eBay have resulted in absolutely zero effect on my account.  Clearly he was in the wrong in every part of this transaction, and he has YET to take responsibility or apologize for his errors.  I would not trust him to act in an appropriate manner in any facet of business, therefore this review is perfectly valid based on the lack of professionalism he has shown.

resp.text: I purchased an item from this guy on ebay(viridel75) Paid May, 3rd. I complained that it wasn't shipped May, 12th. He canceled the sale without me agreeing. Keeps blaming me for his mistakes. Knows nothing about respect!, Now harassing me?.. Reported to ebay.

name: Carla Hardin
text: Momma had a Samsung Galaxy s6 that just needed a new battery.  Ordered a battery from Amazon and they couldn't get the back of the phone off.  So they call the Verizon retail store in hazel green and the girl told her to take it to ch pc repair and he would do it.  My mothers phone worked FINE when she took it in there.  She could do anything and everything on her phone.  When she went to pick it up the phone would not even turn on.   He said he tried both old and new battery and it still wouldn't come on.  So he took the screen off and put it on another phone and the screen works.  So he is saying that the mother board is messed up.  He can check it out BUT he'd have to charge her to do it.  Momma said he really messed the back up,  like it was melted!!  I met her up there and his attitude is  basically "screw you ".  He insisted that the phone was not working when she took it in.  I asked him why he didn't call her and tell her and he said because she didnt leave a number.  To which my reply is "when you work in customer service like this it is your responsibility to get a number so you can get in touch with the person". He is a total jerk!!  He takes ZERO responsibility for his screw ups.  Said he was not going to make it right.  But he did tell her that he'd buy the phone from her when she bought a new one.  Then he threatened to call the cops on us "because it was after hours, he was closed and we wouldn't leave".  He never asked us to leave, period.  He brags about how much money he makes per year and all of his vehicles and house is paid for.  Good for him.  I dont give a 🐁but what he has and doesn't have.  And now Marina tells us that her stepfather took a phone to him that was kinda messed up and was going to get the guy to repair it.  When he went to pick the phone up or really was messed up!!!

resp.text:
Carla,

This issue is between me, and my client Pam Lanford. You came into my office, clearly disgruntled. You then continued to talk over me without giving me a chance to respond or explain the situation.

Pam visited my store with her device, which she believed to have a battery issue. She provided an aftermarket battery and had explained that an attempt was made, using a hairdryer, to open the casing and replace the battery, prior to me looking at the device. When the device was dropped off, I was in the middle of an extensive repair, as well as having a conversation with a different client. Not only that, but the device was dropped off quickly, without any contact information, and with very few details.

I replaced the battery with the after-market battery she provided and then attempted to boot up the device, but to no avail. I investigated further but was unable to find a solution. Pam then arrived to pick up her device, and she was, understandably, very upset to find it not working. She wanted it in working order right then and there, and while I understand her sentiments, I can only do so much so quickly. I needed more time to troubleshoot and determine the problem and possible solution, but she would not allow it. I was even willing to reimburse her with a fair value for her device.

I have been in business for more than 10 years now. I work hard every day, and I like to think that I am very good at what I do. I manage hundreds of computers monthly, and I repair and fix many devices daily (thousands of devices yearly). I can remove a device's back/screen in a few minutes with simply a bit of heat and some playing cards, and I have never had any issues. I would never damage a device intentionally. I treat all repairs as if they were my own. That being said, mistakes can (and do) happen as there are many risks involved with these repairs, but I do my best to make things right. To me, it's not just about collecting payment for the services I provide—although that is necessary for me to stay in business and provide for my family. It's about building long-term relationships with my clients, and I deeply enjoy helping and providing knowledge to my clients.

This is the first complaint I have received with the BBB, and I would truly like to resolve the issue, and have the opportunity to change your outlook on me and your experience with my business. CH PC Repair is my business—it has my name in it, a fact that I am proud of and would never change.

Sincerely,
Chad Harbin
CH PC Repair

resp.text: This customer's phone was quite unusual in that no model number could be found anywhere on the device even when we took the phone apart; there was no model number listed. We ordered a charging port for a similar model but unfortunately it would not work on this customer's device. We tried to explain the problem to our customer. Much time was spent on this phone in trying to find the model number. It's just very unusual for such a device not to have one listed anywhere on the phone. We waived the $40 fee that we could have charged the customer for our efforts. The week delay the customer complained about was due to his electing free shipping instead of having the part expedited. We informed the customer at the start that it would take anywhere from a week or more for a part to arrive if he chose the free shipping option and did not want to pay for it to be expedited. We are sorry to disappoint the customer but we did fully explain to him the time it would take to get the part and that it might not work since we could not find a model number on his device.

resp.text:
We actually do not advertise that we buy any and everything. However though we do say we buy most electronics (depending on the type and condition). We have never advertise in any form that we buy any electronics even if they are really old and broken like your phone that was brought into the store. I spoke with the rep. that assisted you that day and you brought in a Galaxy S3 Sprint broken that is really old and cost more then what we sell them for used. You also brought a Dell tablet that the screen was broken and would cost a lot to fix it and giving its age as well it would not be cost effective to repair and resale.

We are sorry you feel this way but as a business owner you would not buy something that you would spend more on fixing it then what you would sale it for. We are sorry you though we bought any and everything but we have never said that or advertised it.

Thanks,
Nate B. Brewer
Buy-Back Manager

text:
To make a long story short, there was a horrible misunderstanding with my phone.  I broke the screen badly the first time and the wonderful people at phone Probs worked diligently to fix it and make it like brand new again.
After leaving phone Probs(extremely satisfied), I went to the Apple store to buy a phone case for my iPhone 7 Plus. The tech accidentally broke the screen on it and told me it was because the people who replaced my phone screen(He was implying Phone Probs) didn’t instal it right. I was mad, as anyone would be, and I was very expressive in telling phone Probs they owed me a new screen for installing a faulty one. Now, I am a very very VERY  verbal person, and even after I fed them my 2 cents, 25 cents, and a few swear words in between, Drew and his wonderful father still stood by my side and tried to assist me. While they didn’t replace it for free, they showed me how it couldn’t have just broke and the Apple guy probably broke it and didn’t own up to it, they helped me replace the screen and I am forever satisfied with this business again.
They are good people with hearts of gold. And they put up with a lot. And I meant ALOT. So next time you need a phone repair, laptop repair, or even computer, go see these guys at Phone Probs. They will do everything they can to help you be satisfied and keep coming back.
I went from having an iPhone so badly bent and cracked that you couldn’t even use it right to one that looks dang near new! Thank you Phone Probs!

-Google Verified Review

resp.text:
We are sorry to hear this and we strive to do quality work. Although we put a manufacturer warranty on all repairs it does not cover however customer caused damage. You had cracked it so we could not offer to replace it free of charge. We did however offer you a discount due to the inconvenience on your behalf but you did not accept our offer.

We are sorry you broke your phone we understand we break our own too. It happens but we do not cover customer cased damage unfortunately. We do however offer a warranty on accidental breakage but I'm not sure if it was available at the time you got your phone fixed and for this we could offer you that warranty. Please call us and we will be happy to offer the accidental breakage warranty.

Thanks,
Team PhoneProbs

text: My problem is that I was offered a simple solution that I had already been trying and quoted an outrageous price to do it. I was trying to avoid reformatting and losing my data. But that is what they offered and wanted to charge me almost $200 to do it.

resp.text: Since we don’t have a ticket where you actually brought your computer to us, I have to assume that we would have given you worst-case scenario over the phone.  Our trained and qualified techs do everything possible to avoid a wipe and reinstall before doing so.  Worst-case we have to do so, AND that includes data backup and restore - so no data would have been lost.  Our price for a complete data backup, wipe, reinstall, and restore is $169.00, not $200.  Data backup takes a long time in many cases and we charge for our time. Many times we are able to do the repair cheaper, but we never want a client to be surprised halfway through if we have to do the full process.  If you don’t like our pricing, you are free to not use us.  Reviews should be for quality of service, not because you don’t like a price that you are free to refuse.

text: Not trust worthy. Paid them over 1200.00 bucks for custom computer. It NEVER worked correctly. In an out of shop till warranty ran out. Last time in they said mother board was broken. You tell me how did a mother board in a desk top get broken?  I tell you it was broken when they built the desk top that is one of the reasons it NEVER WORKED correctly. The just kept me running back an forth taking it to them to fix till the warranty ran out. A few days after i got it back the last time it was messed up again. I tried to get them to repair an they told me warranty was out....  The money i saved up for this custom desk top computer for a long time was gone. They left me with nothing........ VERY Sad......  Do it your self or hire someone else.  If you notice their reply you will see they said they don't do custom computers anymore  not that they didn't do them. The reason this has been posted again is because they most likely paid to have it removed the first time. They were located by Walmart  at that time. FACT.

resp.text: This is a fraudulent review.  We have not done custom computers in many years and we do not have a customer by this name.  We get this fraudulent review almost word for word over and over by a different name.  This same person continually gives the same negative reviews to other business owners in the area.

Asked many questions of the business over the years and they never seem to know what I'm talking about. name: Megan Green
text: I took my iPhone here for repair. The screen was black, but all functions still remained. I could make and receive phone calls so long as I was connected to a Bluetooth device. It received text messages, made sounds, talked to Siri, etc. when I picked up my phone, it didn't work at all. The screen was now cracked and chipped, and did not function. I could not make Siri come on....after speaking with the manager, which got me no where, she guaranteed my phone would still function as before. It did not. All I got was "there's no charge today," I would hope not as the business put my phone into a worse condition than when they received it.  I had to purchase a new phone and getting my old one repaired now isn't even worth the cost, I can't resell it or anything. I have an ugly paperweight...very dissatisfied. Will not ever bring my business to them again, nor will I give a recommendation to anyone I know. I will gladly tell all to avoid this business for iPhone repair.

name: M . Valentin
text: Took my iPad Air 2 for glass replacement. The person in charge took the iPad to the back of the store and returned a few moments later with a quote of $330. When I told him that his quoted price was higher than the cost of a new unit, he condescendingly said "so get a new one". A lady in front of me complained that they would not honor their warranty. Apparently this is not a place to take your business to. I bought a replacement glass online and proceeded to fix it myself (after watching a bunch of YouTube videos). Saved $300.

resp.text: When we do the repair on the Air2 we do a full assembly including LCD replacement as they are a sealed unit. I would love to find your source of screens as the cheapest on Ebay with no warranty is $135.  Since we purchase new high quality warrantied screens, we are unable to use these cheap quality screens.

text: Took iPhone to have screen replaced seal has relifted and cracked screen again 🤬. Had my sons battery replaced now it won’t charge they’re telling me charging port. Will not be using after today. Seriously frustrated.

resp.text: The iPhone 5S was brought in on April 10th because it was not powering on. We replaced the battery, tested the phone, charged the phone and everything was working. We were contacted on April 13th saying there was a problem, we advised for the phone to be brought back so we could take a look at it. We did not receive the phone back in our store until April 25th. We changed the charging port and the phone was picked up. We received a call back that afternoon saying the issue was still there. We advised to bring it back and we would take a look to see what was going on. We never heard back until this review was posted. I called the very next morning (5-1-18) to see what was going on. I was informed that the iPhone 6s+ screen was broken. I also advised that we have a 90-day warranty on everything we do and they could bring both phones back for us to figure out what was going on and to get them repaired in the warranty period. It is now the end of our business day on Thursday, May 3rd and we still have not been given the opportunity to see what we could do about these issues.
